uk.co.visalia.brightpearl.apiclient.http

Interface ClientFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HttpClient4ClientFactory

    public interface ClientFactory
    Interface for classes that create Clients. In most cases, implementations should cache the client they return from getClient(uk.co.visalia.brightpearl.apiclient.account.Account) and support returning the same instance in response to subsequent calls. If the underlying HTTP client does not support connection pooling or any other form of cached resources for improved performance, implementations may instead return a new client for each request.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Client getClient(Account account)
      Get a client to be used for a given Account.

    • Method Detail

      • getClient

        Client getClient(Account account)

        Get a client to be used for a given Account. This method will be called for every request to be made to the Brightpearl API, so that client instances that support only a single request are supported. Implementations may return the same instance in response to multiple calls to this method, and should do so provided the client is thread-safe and supports multiple concurrent requests.

        Creating a client for each customer account is not recommended but can be used as a method of throttling the resources available to each account, so the account is included as a parameter to allow this.

        Parameters:
        account - The Brightpearl customer account a client is required for.
        Returns:
        A client instance appropriate for the account.
